newsitem.title: USA: Conflicts delay NY-NJ Port Authority project - paper.
newsitem.headline: Conflicts delay NY-NJ Port Authority project - paper.

text.p: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey delayed a New York airport project due to concerns N.J. Gov Christie Whitman raised about a lagging airport project in her state, the Star-Ledger reported.

The New Jersey paper, in its Friday edition, said the commissioners dropped a $7.2 million taxiway for JKF International in New York from the agenda on Thursday, along with a minor agreement affecting New Jersey's Teterboro Airport.
Whitman last week said that lengthening Newark Airport's main runway and a link between the airport's monorail and the Northeast Corridor were being unnecessarily delayed.
She attributed the delay to the concerns of the agency's staff, who feared the project might be seen as giving the New Jersey airport an advantage, the paper said.
New York Mayor Rudolph Giuliani, who in June proposed that the bi-state agency be dismantled, has argued that it favors New Jersey over New York.
New Jersey Transportation Commissioner Frank Wilson, who sits on the Port Authority's board, raised Whitman's concerns, and is boycotting any improvement projects, the paper said.
The commissioner told the paper he expects the matter to be settled by next month, when the agency staff presents a project plan Whitman requested.
